roleset.name: (cause to) be on fire
roleset.note: BURN-V NOTES: The idea in both of these is along the lines of "Trying to enter thelaptop market has burned IBM", making this a relativelystraightforward passivization. (from burn.01-v)

BURN-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry burn.01, OntoNotes grouping burn-n senses 2, 4,& 6; maps to VN classes entity_specific_cos-45.5, entity_specific_modes_being-47.2, light_emission-43.1, other_cos-45.4. Framed by Claire. (from burn.01-n)
BURNING-N NOTES: Corresponds with burn.01. Framed by anwen april 2011 (from burning.01-n)

example.name: metaphorical, 'on' agent
example.text: [Securities analysts]-2 were even more cautious, *trace* having been burned *trace*-2 repeatedly on Unisys this year.

example.name: metaphorical, 'in' agent
example.text: [International Business Machines Corp.]-1, analysts say, has been burned *trace*-1 twice in trying to enter the laptop market and shows no signs of trying to get into notebooks anytime soon.
example.arg: in trying to enter the laptop market

example.name: ergative, literal
example.text: The wood was burning in the fireplace.

example.name: Arg 0 only
example.text: This ointment will relieve the burn and itch of poison ivy.

example.name: ArgMs only
example.text: The smoke from the annual burn on the slopes outside the villages hung in the air.
example.arg: on the slopes outside the villages

example.name: Arg 1 & TMP
example.text: The burn of calories during a marathon is quite high.

example.name: All Arguments
example.text: They are seeking to increase their burn of low-sulphur imported coal.

example.name: NOT EVENTIVE, call .YY.
example.text: But Mr. Warren says the woman has `` psychic burns '' on her back from the confrontation .

example.name: Both args
example.text: Mary's burning of the abandoned barn was only the beginning of her destructive criminal life.

example.name: naughty John
example.text: John burned up his report card in the fireplace.

example.name: literal
example.text: The fire finally burned out after an hour or two.

roleset.name: become tired of, failure/exhaustion due to overexertion
roleset.note: BURN_OUT-V NOTES: I'm not sure about this syntax. With any luck it won't appear in WSJ. (from burn.04-v)
BURNOUT-N NOTES: Added by Julia base on more-nouns. No VNcls. (from burnout.01-n)

example.name: or adjectival?
example.text: John is totally burned out on predicate-argument tagging.

example.name: args
example.text: The error reporting round-ups that Hola used to do in the Loathing forums kind of acted as the feedback for most of Mafia in the past, but I know that they probably also contributed to his burnout on the project.

example.name: with CAU
example.text: Here's how to avoid burnout from stress:
